text: Peter Leslie Carter (19 November 1956 - 2 September 2014) was a British diplomat. He served as the British Deputy High Commissioner to Nigeria from 2012 until his death in 2014. He was also Her Britannic Majesty's Ambassador to Estonia from 2007 until 2012. He had also served in India, Italy and Israel. Carter was born in London. He studied at The Skinners' School in Tunbridge Wells, Kent, and attended New College, Oxford, where he studied Modern Languages. Carter died from a heart attack on 2 September 2014 in Lagos, Nigeria. He was 57. He had just landed at Murtala Muhammed International Airport, Lagos from Houston, Texas in the United States. ==References== ==Other websites== * Peter Carter at gov.uk Category:1956 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Alumni of the University of Oxford Category:British diplomats Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Disease-related deaths in Nigeria Category:Politicians from London Category:Ambassadors of the United Kingdom
title: Peter Carter (diplomat)
